title: CA Technologies Appoints Ava M. Hahn Executive Vice President, General Counsel and Corporate Secretary
text:
Brings extensive leadership and legal expertise in technology and venture capital firms
NEW YORK--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- CA Technologies (NASDAQ:CA) today announced the appointment of Ava M. Hahn as executive vice president, general counsel and corporate secretary. She joins the company from Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, a venture capital firm, where she served as general counsel.
Hahn brings more than 15 years of experience leading legal strategy for public and private companies in the technology and venture capital sectors. Prior to her role at Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, she was general counsel and partner at Felicis Ventures. She also previously served as chief legal officer for publicly-listed Aruba Networks, Inc., ShoreTel, Inc. and Genesis Microchip, Inc.
“I am excited to bring Ava onto our executive team,” said Mike Gregoire, CA Technologies chief executive officer. “Ava is exceptionally qualified to lead our legal team as we continue to transform CA and seize the big opportunities that exist in the application economy. Her extensive legal background in the technology sector and her years of experience in Silicon Valley and beyond make her a very strong addition to our leadership team.”
As general counsel and chief legal officer, Hahn will be responsible for providing legal guidance to the company’s senior management and board of directors. She will oversee all of CA’s legal operations, including corporate governance and compliance, contracts, securities, mergers and acquisitions, intellectual property and litigation.
Hahn succeeds Michael Bisignano, who is leaving the company to pursue other opportunities.
Active in a number of community and professional organizations, Hahn received her J.D. from Columbia Law School and her undergraduate degree from the University of California, Berkeley.
About CA Technologies
CA Technologies (NASDAQ:CA) creates software that fuels transformation for companies and enables them to seize the opportunities of the application economy. Software is at the heart of every business in every industry. From planning, to development, to management and security, CA is working with companies worldwide to change the way we live, transact, and communicate – across mobile, private and public cloud, distributed and mainframe environments.
